meanings.definition: Move all the way around (someone or something) in a circle.
meanings.sent1: The bird was circling above the trees.
meanings.sent2: The children were circling around the maypole.
meanings.sent3: The cat kept circling the toy mouse, trying to catch it.
meanings.sent4: Thoughts were circling in her mind like a whirlwind.
meanings.sent5: The airplane was circling the airport before landing.

meanings.definition: Move in a circle around (someone or something).
meanings.sent1: The dancers were circling around the bonfire.
meanings.sent2: The cars were circling the parking lot looking for a spot.
meanings.sent3: The dog was circling its tail, confused by its own movement.
meanings.sent4: The news was circling the internet like wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The vultures were circling the prey, waiting for an opportunity.

meanings.definition: Go around (someone or something) in a circle.
meanings.sent1: The athletes were circling the track before the race.
meanings.sent2: The shark was circling the boat, making the passengers nervous.
meanings.sent3: The robot vacuum cleaner kept circling the same spot, unable to move on.
meanings.sent4: The rumors were circling the office, causing a stir among employees.
meanings.sent5: The moon was circling the Earth, creating tides.
